Strompris api¶

The strompris module retrieves electricity price data.

Fetch data from https://www.hvakosterstrommen.no/strompris-api and visualize it.

Assignment 5

strompris.fetch_day_prices(date: ~.datetime.date = None, location: str = 'NO1') → DataFrame¶

Fetches electricity prices for a specified date and location from the API.

Parameters:

  • date (datetime.date, optional) -- The date for which to fetch the prices. Defaults to the current date.

  • location (str, optional) -- The location code for which to fetch prices.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing electricity prices for the specified date and location. Includes columns such as 'time_start' and 'NOK_per_kWh'.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.fetch_prices(end_date: ~.datetime.date = None, days: int = 7, locations: list[str] = ('NO1', 'NO2', 'NO3', 'NO4', 'NO5')) → DataFrame¶

Fetches electricity prices for multiple days and locations, compiling them into a single DataFrame.

Parameters:

  • end_date (datetime.date, optional) -- The end date for the data fetching period. Defaults to today.

  • days (int, optional) -- Number of days to include in the data fetching period, counting backwards from the end date. Defaults to 7.

  • locations (list[str], optional) -- List of location codes for which to fetch data. If None, fetches data for all available locations.

Returns:

A DataFrame containing the combined electricity prices data for the specified period and locations.

Return type:

pd.DataFrame

strompris.main()¶

Allow running this module as a script for testing.

strompris.plot_activity_prices(df: DataFrame, activity: str = 'shower', minutes: float = 10) → Chart¶

Plot price for one activity,

Parameters:

  • df (pd.DataFrame) -- DataFrame containing energy prices.

  • activity (str) -- Name of the activity.

  • minutes (float) -- Duration of the activity in minutes.

Returns:

Altair chart displaying energy prices for an activity.

Return type:

alt.Chart

strompris.plot_daily_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Plot the daily average price

x-axis: time_start y-axis: cost in NOK

You may use any mark.

Make sure to document arguments and return value...

strompris.plot_prices(df: DataFrame) → Chart¶

Generates a line chart of electricity prices over time for different locations.

Parameters:

df (pd.DataFrame) -- A DataFrame containing electricity prices data.

Returns:

An Altair Chart representing the line chart.

Return type:

alt.Chart
